page.title: 10Isle of Wight Railway,Ashey
page.content: The railway is operated by a group of enthusiasts as a tourist attraction.At the moment the track runs from Havenstreet to Wootton but the Company has plans to reopen the line between {Havenstreet and Smallbrook}where the British Rail trains still run.The plan includes an interchange at Smallbrook. The trackbed is leased from the County for Â£1000 p.a. As a first step the undergrowth is being cleared.This work is being undertaken by a group called Community Task Force. There are 72 people in the group which is paid for by the{Manpower Services {Commission}as part of the Government's plan to provide work for the unemployed.They hope to have a further contract in 1986 to clean the ballast. The farmer at Whitefield is not so keen as the railway cuts his farm in two.
